Title: Clinical features and differential diagnosis of parkinson’s disease
Abstract: © Springer-Verlag Wien 2017.Parkinson’s disease (PD) is a clinically defined, progressive neurodegenerative movement disorder with a broad differential diagnosis. Firstly, we will discuss the typical clinical features of PD and its underlying pathology and aetiology. We will then explore the possible differential diagnoses in relation to age at onset, encompassing juvenile/early-onset PD, PD in mid life and PD in the elderly. We will outline the typical features of each differential and useful investigations, which will help to reach the correct diagnosis. Finally, we will provide a practical guide of how to approach a parkinsonian patient in a clinical setting.
